questions.question_text: A technician is adding a folder to a structure that is several levels down from the top level. The technician wants to make sure the new folder will have the same permissions as the top level. Which of the following should the technician configure?
A user moves a file from one NTFS disk to another NTFS disk. Which of the following describes the changes to the file permissions?

comments.content: just tested it out on my computer having 2 NTFS. Destination applies

discussion.content: D is correct. Destination applies the permissions.

A is definately wrong!
When moving on the same partition, the permissions stays the same,
BUT when moving to a different partition/drive LIKE IN THIS QUESTION, the file gets the permission from the destination. > Answer D

Selected Answer: D
By default, an object inherits permissions from its parent object, either at the time of creation or when it is copied or moved to its parent folder. The only exception to this rule occurs when you move an object to a different folder on the same volume. In this case, the original permissions are retained.

See this link: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/troubleshoot/windows-client/windows-security/permissions-on-copying-moving-files

Selected Answer: D
Destination!

Selected Answer: D
Same Volume:
Move - Keeps original permissions
Copy - Inherits new permissions

Different Volume:
Move - Inherits new permissions
Copy - Inherits new permissions

choices.D: The file receives the destination permissions
choices.A: The file has both the source and destination permissions
choices.C: The file permissions have to be set manually
choices.B: The file keeps the source permissions

comments.content:
shadow copy is for Windows
snapshot is for Mac
Question specifies Windows, does not mention Mac.

discussion.content: I feel A D are correct answers
A. File level & D. Shadow Copy

Snapshots allow the creation of consistent backups of a volume, ensuring that the contents do not change and are not locked while the backup is being made. The core component of shadow copy is the Volume Shadow Copy service, which initiates and oversees the snapshot creation process. C& D is correct

Shadow Copy is a technology included in Microsoft Windows that can create backup copies or snapshots of computer files or volumes, even when they are in use. It is implemented as a Windows service called the Volume Shadow Copy service
Snapshots are created within Windows from the System Restore program
I assume C refers to a VM Snapshot and not a Time Machine backup on Mac.

questions.question_text: A customer recently lost data because it was accidentally deleted. The customer calls a technician and asks to have a Windows backup solution installed. The customer needs to ensure all company data is backed up and quickly recoverable every time a change is made. Which of the following solutions would the technician MOST likely recommend? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: D looks correct answer. Reason is under internet properties, we have content tab, if we click onto it, we see certificate option. Under certificate we can remove.
certificate: internet option- Content

Selected Answer: B
clear ssl state is the real answer here, in the question technician have setup new certificate on the computer that means that it's already added under internet options/content/certificate, but the browser cache the previous certificate that has no approval of the site so he need to clear SSL state under content tab to clear cache and use the newly added certificate.

questions.question_text:
A user browses to a company's intranet page and receives an invalid certificate message. A technician discovers the certificate has expired. A new certificate is put in place and installed on the user's computer; however, the user still receives the same message when going to the intranet page. The technician tries with a third-party browser and connects without error. The technician needs to make sure the old certificate is no longer used in Internet Explorer. Which of the following
Internet Options should the technician use to ensure the old certificate is removed?

A technician has identified malware on a user's system.
Which of the following should the technician do NEXT according to malware removal best practices?

choices.C: Update the antivirus software and run a full system scan
choices.D: Move the infected system to a lab with no network connectivity
choices.A: Enable System Restore and create a restore point so no data is lost
choices.B: Educate the user about how to avoid malware in the future

discussion.content:
The answer is correct. That's quarantining the system, which is the second step in the malware removal process, it comes after Identifying and researching malware symptoms. 
The seven steps are: 
1. Identify and research malware symptoms.
2. Quarantine the infected systems.
3. Disable System Restore (in Windows).
4. Remediate the infected systems.
A. Update the anti-malware software.
B. Scan and use removal techniques (Safe Mode, Preinstallation
Environment).
5. Schedule scans and run updates.
6. Enable System Restore and create a restore point (in Windows).
7. Educate the end user.

A good mnemonic to use is 
I (Identify)
Question (Q- Quarantine)
Dad's (D- Disable)
Reasons (R- Remediate)
Some (S- Schedule)
Early (Enable)
Evenings (E- Educate)

comments.content: This is a great saying, but doesn't it leave out create restore point. So it should be quarantine, disable, remediate, schedule, re-enable, create restore point, then educate
Nevermind, you just have it worded differently :)
